Structured Database Management Systems (DBMS) based on relational and other models have long formed the basis for such databases. In this background the course examines data structures, file organizations, concepts and principles of DBMS?É?í?Ç¬¢?É¬¢?¢‚Ç¨?°?Ç¬¨?É¬¢?¢‚Ç¨?æ?Ç¬¢s, data analysis, database design, data modeling, database management, data & query optimization, and database implementation. More specifically, the course introduces relational data models; entity-relationship modeling, SQL, data normalization, and database design. Further it introduces query coding practices using MySQL (or any other open system) through various assignments. Design of simple multi-tier client / server architectures based and Web-based database applications is also introduced.
